cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 75 miles south of Kingston, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northwest across the north-western Caribbean, forecast to cross western Cuba Tuesday, enter the southeastern Gulf of Mexico Wednesday and then accelerate toward the central Louisiana coast late Thursday into Friday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast (between Vermilion Bay and the Mississippi River delta)

port.name: Port of Greater Baton Rouge, LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch for Pinar del Rio & Artemisa provinces of Cuba and Isle of Youth; Tropical Storm Watch for La Habana, Cuba
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning for the Cayman Islands
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire north-central Gulf Coast from Texas-Louisiana border eastward to the Florida Panhandle, with greatest risk along the Louisiana coastline
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are possible at the port late Thursday night into Friday with an 18–27% chance of sustained 34-kt winds and up to 8% chance of 50-kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Surge of 3–5 ft is forecast for the lower Louisiana coast; limited upriver surge may produce elevated water levels at the port but major inundation is not expected.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches of rainfall with locally higher totals could produce flash flooding and river rises in the Baton Rouge area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Possible river flooding, strong squalls reducing visibility, and electrical/communications outages that may disrupt cargo handling and vessel movements.
